item.title: All Roblox It Girl Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
It Girl is a fashion game in Roblox that lets players dress up in outfits. Here is every active reward code in the Roblox game so far.

It Girl is a game in Roblox that lets players strut their stuff most fashionably, looking more stylish than the rest. It has even started making use of reward codes. Below, we’ll reveal every active reward code in the game so you can take advantage.

We’ll also keep track of all expired codes, so you’ll always know which ones are ready to use to unleash your inner mage.

Every Active Roblox It Girl Code & Reward (August 2025)

Below, you can find all of the active codes in It Girl for August 2025.

Use these codes before they eventually expire, as most codes in Roblox do.

How to Redeem Roblox It Girl Codes

To redeem codes, just follow these easy steps:

  1. Launch Roblox, then the It Girl game.
  2. Click on the Gear Icon on the left side of the screen.
  3. Type in the code you want, and tap the Redeem button.

If the code is still active, then you’ll receive the reward. Remember, each code can only be used once per user account.

All Expired Roblox It Girl Codes

As of August 2025, here are all the expired codes.

It’s always worth trying expired codes, as they still may work with some accounts.

Where to Find Roblox It Girl Codes

Be sure to bookmark this page if you want to always know which codes are active. That’s because we’ll be sure to update it when new codes come in.

Do you love the stylish Roblox games? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best games.

While you’re here, you can also check out our other Roblox adventure game guides: Flashpoint Worlds Collide, Lost Currents, and One Touch.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Roblox Supermarket Together Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Supermarket Together is a trolley dash game in Roblox. Here is every active and expired code for the game this month.

If you love Roblox but also enjoy a bit of shopping for fun, then Supermarket Together may be an ideal game for you. But the game also has its own coupons, which double up as reward codes!

Below, we’ve compiled all the active reward codes for this month to help you secure the best deals. We’ll also keep track of all expired codes.

Every Active Roblox Supermarket Together Code & Reward (August 2025)

Below, you can find all of the active codes for August 2025.

Codes are likely to expire over time, so make sure you use them before they do.

How to Redeem Supermarket Together Codes in Roblox

To redeem codes, just follow the steps below:

  1. Launch Roblox and then the Supermarket Together game.
  2. Press the Z key to bring up the ‘Codes’ option.
  3. Type in the code you want, and press ‘Enter’.

If the code is still active, then you’ll receive the reward. Remember, you can only use a code once per user account.

All Expired Roblox Supermarket Together Codes

As of August 2025, here are all the expired codes.

Remember, codes sometimes keep working after expiring, so it’s always worth giving them one final try.

Where to Find Roblox Supermarket Together Codes

While you’re here, make sure you bookmark this page. That’s because we’ll update it when new codes come in.

Remember, fresh and new codes tend to appear first on the game’s official Discord server. This is another great way to get codes before anyone else.

Be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best games in Roblox.

If you’re a fan of shopping games in Roblox, you can also check out our code guides for Supermarket Simulator, Restaurant Tycoon, and Build a Scam Empire.

item.title: Lost Soul Aside Gets Surprise Demo, Launches Tomorrow
item.content:encoded:
Lost Soul Aside is getting a surprise demo just in time for launch. The upcoming RPG, set to release tomorrow, is one of PlayStation’s biggest titles of the year. While marketing has been quite silent, it looks like we now have more to go off of than before.

The story of Lost Soul Aside follows Kaser, an orphan who travels to different worlds and dimensions, alongside the mysterious Arena, to save his sister. The action-RPG looks like what you’d see in Final Fantasy, which is what creator Yang Bing was inspired off of. With many excited for the title, fans can get a taste of it come launch day.

Lost Soul Aside Free Demo Available Tomorrow

Launching alongside the full game of Lost Soul Aside will be a free demo. In it, players will get to try out the game’s flashy combat. Only two bosses will be available to play (Rose Queen and Holy Knight Commander Victor), so it’s likely not a long demo. Even more so, save data from the demo does not carry over to the full game, so you’ll have to fight the two again. Still, it’s a good way to test the game out before purchasing if you haven’t pre-ordered.

The demo, currently, is only for PlayStation 5, so no word on if PC users will get the demo or not. As of publishing, there’s no mention of a demo on Steam. Select regions, such as Australia, Japan, and New Zealand can download and play the demo right now. For others, the demo rolls out tomorrow, August 29th, though timing will likely vary depending on your region.

Having been in development for more than a decade, Lost Soul Aside has been through quite a lot. Starting as a one-man passion project by Yang Bing, the game was chosen by PlayStation to enter full development. Under the banner of UltiZero Games, the small team changed the Final Fantasy XV-inspired game to a new original IP we now know as Lost Soul Aside.

Are you excited to try out Lost Soul Aside? Let us know in the comments below and on the forums!

For more on Lost Soul Aside, check out our articles on the team’s response to early copies going out and when the embargo is. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter for more Insider Gaming goodness!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Mega Hawlucha Soars Into Action In Pokémon Legends: Z-A
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon Legends: Z-A has announced the next Pokémon to get a Mega Evolution: Hawlucha. The highly anticipated title, set to release on October 16th, has been revealing more and more up to release. It was teased earlier this week that a new Pokémon would get a Mega Evolution. Finally, we now know which Pokémon it was, and it’s a fan-favorite.

The development of Pokémon Legends Z-A goes back at least a couple of years. It wasn’t until this year that we saw any gameplay, but, now, it won’t be long until we play it. Set in the Kalos region, featured in Pokémon X and Y, gameplay will be more real-time than the traditional turn-based combat. Still, many enjoyed it in Pokémon Legends: Arceus and, according to recent previews, it works quite well.

In the trailer, shown above, we see Hawlucha take on a Machamp in Pokémon Legends: Z-A. Towards the end of the trailer, the Hawlucha transforms into Mega Hawlucha and shows off some impressive moves. It’s a great spectacle, made even better by another CG trailer released alongside it. In that, we get a full-on wrestling match between the two Pokémon, which is fitting for them.

Hawlucha, first shown in 2013’s Pokémon X and Y, is a Fighting and Flying-type Pokémon. Inspired by Latin American wrestlers, it can perform the powerful Flying Press. Hawlucha has appeared in many other Pokémon titles like Sword and Shield, as well as Scarlet and Violet. Seeing the character’s popularity, it’s not surprising that many are delighted to see Mega Hawlucha enter the ring in Pokémon Legends: Z-A.

Are you excited to see Mega Hawlucha in Pokémon Legends: Z-A? What other Pokémon do you want to see Mega Evolve? Let us know in the comments below and on the forums!

For more Pokémon, check out our preview of Pokémon Legends: Z-A and the latest on TCG. As always, make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Over 450 Diablo Developers Have Unionized
item.content:encoded:
Another major union is forming in the video game space as over 450 developers of Blizzard’s Diablo franchise have voted to unionize.

The Communication Workers of America (CWA) has announced that the developers will be a member of one of three available unions—CWA Local 9510 in Irvine, Calif.; CWA Local 1118 in Albany, N.Y.; and CWA Local 6215 in Austin, Texas. The employees joining include developers, artists, engineers, designers and support staffs.

According to the CWA, the new union is “one of the largest wall-to-wall unions at a Microsoft-owned studio.” It also comes just weeks after Blizzard’s Story and Franchise Development teams voted to unionize.

“I grew up playing Diablo, and I feel lucky that I get to work at Blizzard on a game that’s very special to me and the gaming community,” Diablo software engineer Skye Hoefling said. “But passion can’t protect us from job instability. Our union allows us to focus on making magical experiences for our players instead of worrying about the unstable job industry.”

Designer Ryan Littleton added that the last round of Microsoft layoffs had him more determined to make sure employees are taken care of.

“[None] of us should have to live with that constant worry that we might be let go at the drop of a hat,” he said. “A union allows us to organize across the industry to make great games and protect the developers who create them from the constant pressures of layoffs, passion tax, and crunch.”

CWA says Microsoft has recognized the union’s formation. Since July 2024, CWA says that over 3,500 Microsoft employees have unionized with the group.

What do you think of more video game unions forming, this time with over 450 Diablo developers? Let us know down below, and join the official Insider Gaming forums for even more gaming discussions.

For more Insider Gaming, read about Wizards of the Coast hiring a number of developers who previously worked on the canceled Black Panther game at EA. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
